column1: Group Category Code Description
AC Directives AC "Answer calls
CL Directives CL "Call attention to hearer by name or by substitute exclamations"

RPCS Directives RP "Request propose or suggest an action for hearer or for hearer and speaker."
RPCS Directives CS "Counter-suggestion
WS Statements WS "Express a wish."
SS Directives SS "Signal to start performing an act such as running or rolling a ball"
WD Directives WD "Warn of danger."
CXSC "Speech Elicitations" CX "Complete text if so demanded."
CXSC "Speech Elicitations" SC "Complete statement or other utterance in compliance with request."
EAEIECEX "Speech Elicitations" EA "Elicit onomatopoeic or animal sounds."
EAEIECEX "Speech Elicitations" EI "Elicit imitation of word or sentence by modelling or by explicit command"
EAEIECEX "Speech Elicitations" EC "Elicit completion of word or sentence."
EAEIECEX "Speech Elicitations" EX "Elicit completion of rote-learned text."
RT "Speech Elicitations" RT "Repeat or imitate other's utterance."
PA Commitments PA "Permit hearer to perform act."
PF Commitments PF "Prohibit/forbid/protest hearer's performance of an act"
SI Commitments SI "State intent to carry out act by speaker."
PD Commitments PD "Promise."
TD Commitments TD "Threaten to do."
MKTOXA Markings MK "Mark occurrence of event (thank greet apologize congratulate etc.)."
MKTOXA Markings TO "Mark transfer of object to hearer"
MKTOXA Markings XA "Exhibit attentiveness to hearer."
CMEMED Markings CM "Commiserate express sympathy for hearer's distress."
CMEMED Markings EM "Exclaim in distress pain."
CMEMED Evalutions ED "Exclaim in disapproval."
EN Markings EN "Express positive emotion."
ES Markings ES "Express surprise."
STAPDWTXCT Statements ST "Make a declarative statement."
STAPDWTXCT Statements AP "Agree with proposition or proposal expressed by previous speaker"
STAPDWTXCT Statements DW "Disagree with proposition expressed by previous speaker."
STAPDWTXCT Performances TX "Read or recite written text aloud."
STAPDWTXCT "Text editing" CT "Correct provide correct verbal form in place of erroneous one."
GR Directives GR "Give reason
column2: justify a request for an action refusal or prohibition"

column1: DC Declarations DC "Create a new state of affairs by declaration"
DP Declarations DP "Declare make-believe reality."
AQ Questions AQ "Aggravated question expression of disapproval by restating a question"
AA Questions AA "Answer in the affirmative to yes/no question."
YD Declarations YD "Agree to a declaration."
ADALGI Directives AD "Agree to carry out an act requested or proposed by other."
ADALGI Directives AL "Agree to do something for the last time."
ADALGI Directives GI "Give in
AN Questions AN "Answer in the negative to yes/no question"
ND Declarations ND "Disagree with a declaration."
RD Directives RD "Refuse to carry out an act requested or proposed by other."
EQ Questions EQ "Eliciting question (e.g. hmm?)."
NA Questions NA "Intentionally nonsatisfying answer to question"
QN Questions QN "Ask a product-question (wh-question)"
RR "Demands for clarification" RR "Request to repeat utterance."
RA Questions RA "Refuse to answer."
SA Questions SA "Answer a wh-question with a statement."
TA Questions TA "Answer a limited-alternative question."
QA Questions QA "Answer a question with a wh-question."
YA Questions YA "Answer a question with a yes/no question."
YQTQ Questions YQ "Ask a yes/no question."
YQTQ Questions TQ "Ask a limited-alternative yes/no question."
RQ Directives RQ "Yes/no question or suggestion about hearer's wishes and intentions"
FP Commitments FP "Ask for permission to carry out act."
PRCN Performances PR "Perform verbal move in game."
PRCN Statements CN "Count."
ABPMET Evalutions AB "Approve of appropriate behavior."
ABPMET Evalutions PM "Praise for motor acts i.e for nonverbal behavior."
ABPMET Evalutions ET "Express enthusiasm for hearer's performance."
CRDS Evalutions CR "Criticize or point out error in nonverbal act."
CRDS Evalutions DS "Disapprove scold protest disruptive behavior."
YYOO Vocalizations YY "Make a word-like utterance without clear function."
